alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 1:51AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN LARIMER AND NORTHWEST WELD COUNTY... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 149 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Cheyenne to near Livermore, or along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Cheyenne to 19 miles northwest of Fort Collins and moving southeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Carr, Rockport, Natural Fort, Livermore and Teds Place. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 280 and 297. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow affecting I-25 near the Wyoming border. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
